item.title: [STORM-167] Freeze/unfreeze sprint
item.description:
Add a "Freeze" button to sprints. When clicked, a sprint becomes frozen:

- no stories can be moved in and out of it
- stories cannot be moved up/down inside it
- populate and empty operations are disabled
- "Freeze" button becomes "Unfreeze"
- graphical appearance changes to indicate the it is frozen

When "Unfreeze" button is clicked, revert and make sprint modifiable again.
item.summary: Freeze/unfreeze sprint

item.title: [STORM-166] Freeze/unfreeze release
item.description:
Add a "Freeze" button to releases. When clicked, a release becomes frozen:

- no stories can be moved in and out of it
- stories cannot be moved up/down inside it
- populate and empty operations are disabled
- "Freeze" button becomes "Unfreeze"
- graphical appearance changes to indicate the it is frozen

When "Unfreeze" button is clicked, revert and make release modifiable again.
item.summary: Freeze/unfreeze release

item.title: [STORM-165] Use a button to go from Release Planning to Sprint Planning
item.description: Instead of using the release title on top of each release box as a link to the corresponding Sprint Planning page, turn the link into inactive text and provide a button with label "Sprint Planning", besides to title, to implement the link.
item.summary: Use a button to go from Release Planning to Sprint Planning

item.title: [STORM-164] Make more than three releases visible
item.description: Currently at most three unreleased releases are shown in the Release Planning page. The requirement is to show a button or link "More releases..." than when pressed would show all unreleased releases.
item.summary: Make more than three releases visible

comments.comment: The other releases should be show exactly like the three first ones. At present the layout of releases is done using a table, where every release is a table cell (<TD>). By default, at most three cells are shown, but if the link "More releases..." is clicked, the page must be redrawn without limits on the number of cells.

item.title: [STORM-163] Show only releases that have a not-null release date in the future
item.description:
In the Release Planning page right hand side show at most 3 releases whose release date is not null and is set in the future. Order them by increasing release date.

At the moment, also releases with no release date set are shown and this is not correct.
item.summary: Show only releases that have a not-null release date in the future

item.title: [STORM-162] Size of planned stories becomes editable again after a refresh
item.description:
After a story is moved from the backlog to a sprint or a release, the "size" field is (correctly) not editable. If the page is refreshed, though, the size field becomes editable again.

See also STORM-55, as it might be sensible to fix this bug by making all fields of planned stories not editable once and for all.
item.summary: Size of planned stories becomes editable again after a refresh

comments.comment: Fixed size and value editing in last revision. Only moscow menu currently is editable.

item.title: [STORM-161] Replace "/" with "|" between size and value
item.summary: Replace "/" with "|" between size and value

item.title: [STORM-160] Empty/populate won't work on IE
item.description: Populate/Empty buttons raise an exception in IE 6/7 (It seems that the action doesn't receive the value of sprintId)
item.summary: Empty/populate won't work on IE

item.title: [STORM-159] Only show Component Spaces in initial page
item.description:
In the initial page for the plugin, showing the list of projects, only show projects of type "Component Space".

Also do not show a link to the project lead.
item.summary: Only show Component Spaces in initial page

item.title: [STORM-158] Use coloured bar for display of remaining velocity
item.description: In Release Planning page, just like it's done in Sprint Planning page
item.summary: Use coloured bar for display of remaining velocity

comments.comment: Duplicates STORM-68

item.title: [STORM-157] Make "splitter" more evident
item.description: Make the thin bar that can be dragged to resize panes in a split-pane more visible (thicker, more contrasting color)
item.summary: Make "splitter" more evident

item.title: [STORM-156] Tooltip for story type icon
item.description: When hovering over a story type icon, display tooltip showing the story type name (i.e. "Component Story", "Developer Story").
item.summary: Tooltip for story type icon

item.title: [STORM-155] Remove "Sprint" label in Sprint boxes
item.description: Show only the Sprint name, without a "Sprint" label in front.
item.summary: Remove "Sprint" label in Sprint boxes

item.title: [STORM-154] Change "Up" with "Release Plan"
item.description: The text of the link in Sprint Planning page that links to the parent Release must be "Release Plan" instead of "Up"
item.summary: Change "Up" with "Release Plan"

item.title: [STORM-151] Stories can still be dragged (not dropped) when sorted by key, title, etc.
item.description: When we sort based on key or title etc where drag & drop ranking is disabled, I am still able to drag the stories though not able to drop them or change the position.
item.summary: Stories can still be dragged (not dropped) when sorted by key, title, etc.

item.title: [STORM-150] Use "TBA" instead of "undefined"
item.description:
When the "size" or "business value" fields are null, display "TBA" instead of "undefined" and make a tooltip with the following text appear when hovering the mouse pointer, respectively:

* The Story Size has yet to be set by the delivery team, following customer collaboration.
* The Story Business Value has yet to be set by the customer, following discussion with the delivery team.
item.summary: Use "TBA" instead of "undefined"

item.title: [STORM-149] Story detail tooltip font is too small
item.description: The popup box that appears when hovering over an issue key has a very small font in some cases and it is unreadable. Make sure the font used in the box is the same size everywhere and large enough.
item.summary: Story detail tooltip font is too small

item.title: [STORM-148] Not estimated developer stories are not shown in red box
item.description: In parent-child view, developer stories that do not have a size are not shown anywhere. They should be displayed in the red box or possibly under their own parent, but not be draggable in any case.
item.summary: Not estimated developer stories are not shown in red box

comments.comment: Apparently in some situations the problem is still present. We need to talk and I'll show you when this happens.
Forget about it, it's a different issue I will open another ticket for it.

item.title: [STORM-147] Issue summary in parent-child view loses bold after sorting
item.summary: Issue summary in parent-child view loses bold after sorting

item.title: [STORM-146] Velocity error in logs
item.description: WARN [velocity] org.apache.velocity.runtime.exception.ReferenceException: reference : template = templates/action/apt/releasePlanningView.vm [line 6,column 159] : $flatViewType is not a valid reference.
item.summary: Velocity error in logs

item.title: [STORM-144] Already planned Stories with size greater than remaining velocity cannot be reranked by drag&drop
item.description:
How to replicate:

* Populate a release until the remaining velocity is some value R greater than zero
* Click and drag a story planned for that release which has a size less than or equal to R.
* Verify that it can be dropped to a different position inside the release.
* Click and drag a story planned for that release which has a size greater than R.
* Verify that it cannot be dropped to a different position inside the release.

Probably, the action of dropping a story checks the remaining velocity but does not take into account the fact that the story is coming from the same release. The check is OK for stories coming from the backlog, but for drag&drop inside a single release it is harmful.
item.summary: Already planned Stories with size greater than remaining velocity cannot be reranked by drag&drop

comments.comment: Currently seems that is impossible to rank a story by drag and drop with size greater than remaining velocity. But i can drag and drop another story at the same rank of the story with size greater than remaining velocity. Is it a proper behavior?

item.title: [STORM-143] Story type icons disappear after reordering
item.description: After reordering stories, story type icons are not displayed anymore
item.summary: Story type icons disappear after reordering

item.title: [STORM-142] Cannot drag&drop component stories with no children in parent-child view
item.description: When in parent-child view, component stories with no children cannot be dropped onto a Sprint.
item.summary: Cannot drag&drop component stories with no children in parent-child view

item.title: [STORM-141] It is possible to overflow sprint velocity
item.description: When doing sprint planning via drag&drop there is no check that the destination sprint remaining velocity is high enough to accomodate the story being dropped, so it's possible to overflow the sprint velocity and make the remaining velocity value go negative.
item.summary: It is possible to overflow sprint velocity

item.title: [STORM-140] When non numeric values are entered in size or value fields the textbox disappear
item.summary: When non numeric values are entered in size or value fields the textbox disappear

item.title: [STORM-139] Clicking on "move to backlog" button when backlog is empty gives 404 error
item.description:
1. Switch to parent-child view.

2. Click "populate" on a sprint so that the backlog is empty.

(Notice that at this moment the view is switched back to flat, which is not nice.)

3. Click the left arrow button on the first story in the sprint.

The following message appears in the backlog:

HTTP Status 404 - No view for result [input] exists for action [RemoveFromSprintAction]

type Status report

message No view for result [input] exists for action [RemoveFromSprintAction]

description The requested resource (No view for result [input] exists for action [RemoveFromSprintAction]) is not available.
item.summary: Clicking on "move to backlog" button when backlog is empty gives 404 error

item.title: [STORM-138] Parent-child links are from child to parent
item.description:
The direction of links between parent and child stories in STORM is always from child to parent and not vice-versa.

Verify that the code always does the right thing (getInwardLinks vs. getOutwardLinks)
item.summary: Parent-child links are from child to parent

item.title: [STORM-137] When moving developer story to backlog, clear both the release (fix for) and sprint fields
item.summary: When moving developer story to backlog, clear both the release (fix for) and sprint fields

item.title: [STORM-136] Velocity errors in the logs
item.description:
When refreshing the sprint planning page, messages like the following are printed to the console:

2008-12-17 10:02:32,183 http-8080-Processor22 ERROR [velocity] RHS of #set statement is null. Context will not be modified. templates/action/apt/sprintPlanningView.vm [line 121, column 1]
2008-12-17 10:02:32,184 http-8080-Processor22 ERROR [velocity] Left side ($!viewType) of '==' operation has null value. If a reference, it may not be in the context. Operation not possible. templates/action/apt/sprintPlanningView.vm [line 154, column 58]
2008-12-17 10:02:32,184 http-8080-Processor22 ERROR [velocity] Left side ($!viewType) of '==' operation has null value. If a reference, it may not be in the context. Operation not possible. templates/action/apt/sprintPlanningView.vm [line 175, column 58]
item.summary: Velocity errors in the logs

item.title: [STORM-135] More than one value stored for custom field id 'customfield_10040'
item.description:
When refreshing the sprint planning page, messages like the following are printed to the console:

2008-12-17 10:02:11,260 http-8080-Processor19 ERROR [issue.customfields.impl.AbstractSingleFieldType] More than one value stored for custom field id 'customfield_10040' for issue 'EX-15'. Values [100502, 100502, 100502, 100502, 100502]
item.summary: More than one value stored for custom field id 'customfield_10040'

comments.comment:
A similar error message appears when moving stories to a sprint:

ERROR [issue.customfields.impl.AbstractSingleFieldType] More than one value stored for custom field id 'customfield_10120' for issue 'CLARITY-16'. Values [2.0, 2.0]

item.title: [STORM-134] Ordering in flat mode makes all stories disappear from backlog
item.description: If you change the ordering of stories in flat mode, all stories disappear from backlog. Switching to parent-child and then back to flat mode, the stories become visible again.
item.summary: Ordering in flat mode makes all stories disappear from backlog

item.title: [STORM-133] Changing the ordering makes it possible to plan component stories with children
item.description:
When switching to parent-child view, it is not possible to move component stories with children to a sprint.

But if you change the ordering to any other field but rank, it then becomes possible to move them, and it should not.
item.summary: Changing the ordering makes it possible to plan component stories with children

item.title: [STORM-132] "Back" to planning plugin
item.description:
Sometimes, it will be possible to click on a link in the plugin which leads to an edit story/release/sprint page in STORM. When the user is done editing, it would be useful to have a "back" button which returns to the plugin page, showing the same view as before going to the edit page, but with refreshed data.

This issue needs integration work with the STORM developers.
item.summary: "Back" to planning plugin

item.title: [STORM-131] Use buttons for actions, in preference to links
item.description: Links that invoke actions that modify the state of a sprint/release (e.g. populate, empty, freeze, rank, etc.) must be buttons instead. Use a form with a POST method.
item.summary: Use buttons for actions, in preference to links

item.title: [STORM-130] Two-tiered ranking
item.description: Rank assigned to stories at release planning stage should be kept in a separate field from rank assigned to stories in sprint planning stage. The two rankings must not interfere and it should not be possible to change release-level rank from Sprint Planning page and vice-versa.
item.summary: Two-tiered ranking

item.title: [STORM-129] Component stories with children should be shown in red box
item.description: In flat view, component stories with children, which are not plannable, hould be displayed in red box, instead of disappearing.
item.summary: Component stories with children should be shown in red box

item.title: [STORM-128] Indicate name of selected release
item.description: Indicate name of selected release at the top of backlog (near the "Backlog" label)
item.summary: Indicate name of selected release

item.title: [STORM-127] Use less vertical space for empty sprints
item.description: Empty sprints should waste less vertical space. Decrease minimum height.
item.summary: Use less vertical space for empty sprints

item.title: [STORM-126] Settings should be persisted when switching between views
item.description: When going back and forth between release/sprint planning and flat/hierarchical views, settings link "sort by" column should be preserved
item.summary: Settings should be persisted when switching between views

item.title: [STORM-125] Empty Sprint
item.description: Provide a button for each sprint that moves all stories allocated to that Sprint back to the backlog, just like it's done for Release planning.
item.summary: Empty Sprint

item.title: [STORM-124] Links from release planning page to sprint planning page and vice-versa
item.description:
On Release planning page, provide links for each Release that links to the specific Sprint planning page.

On Sprint planning page, provide a link to Release planning page.
item.summary: Links from release planning page to sprint planning page and vice-versa

item.title: [STORM-123] "Add Sprint" feature
item.description:
Provide a button to add a new Sprint to a Release.

Must check that we are not overflowing a Release duration.
item.summary: "Add Sprint" feature

item.title: [STORM-122] Help button
item.description: Include a help button in all pages that opens a help page (configurable URL) in a new window/tab.
item.summary: Help button

item.title: [STORM-121] Tool-tips
item.description: Implement tool-tips over most links/buttons. Text to be provided by BT.
item.summary: Tool-tips

item.title: [STORM-120] Display due date of sprints and releases
item.description: Display the "due date" information for both sprints and releases
item.summary: Display due date of sprints and releases

item.title: [STORM-119] Change "order by" with "sort by"
item.summary: Change "order by" with "sort by"

item.title: [STORM-118] Use story icon in story box
item.description: In story boxes, use the issue type icon defined in JIRA to differentiate between story types.
item.summary: Use story icon in story box

item.title: [STORM-117] Make story key and title bold, and not line below
item.description: Unlike Jen's mockup, in parent story boxes, story key and title should be bold, and "Developer stories" label should not.
item.summary: Make story key and title bold, and not line below

comments.comment: This is for parent-child view only
Now Component stories key and title are bold in sprint view, but only in parent child view.
Showing story titles in bold
This can still happen if the page is in parent-child view mode and you click "Populate" on a Sprint (see screenshot)

item.title: [STORM-116] Display release details
item.description: Request more info: which details and where?
item.summary: Display release details

item.title: [STORM-115] Show foreseen completion sprint for Component Story
item.description: In parent-child view, display for each component story an indication of the sprint where the story will be completed, based on where its children stories are allocated.
item.summary: Show foreseen completion sprint for Component Story

item.title: [STORM-114] Order by MoSCoW in parent-child view
item.description: In parent-child view, "order by" button should only allow ordering by MoSCoW, wherein parent stories are sorted according to their decreasing MoSCoW status and child stories within a parent are sorted in the same way.
item.summary: Order by MoSCoW in parent-child view

comments.comment: Ordering is already performed accroding to all columns.

item.title: [STORM-113] Component stories can be moved to sprint even if they have children
item.description:
When a component story has children, it must not be moveable to a Sprint. However this rule applies even for component stories whose children have all been moved to a sprint.

To demostrate this bug, move all child developer stories of a component story to a sprint. The parent component story is not moveable and that's correct. Now refresh the page, or switch from parent-child to flat view and see the component story display "No developers stories" and become moveable.
item.summary: Component stories can be moved to sprint even if they have children

item.title: [STORM-112] Stories planned for sprints don't show size and value
item.description: Show size and value that are currently missing from stories assigned to sprints
item.summary: Stories planned for sprints don't show size and value

comments.comment: In the PPT document this information are not visible in stories assigned to a sprint.
That was just an oversigh on Jen's part. All stories should display size and value.
Now size and value are visible in sprint view as well

item.title: [STORM-111] Restrict freeze/unfreeze feature based on group
item.description: Make the freeze/unfreeze feature available only to a list of specific user groups in the system.
item.summary: Restrict freeze/unfreeze feature based on group

item.title: [STORM-110] Show total sprint velocity
item.description:
Display the total velocity of each sprint together with utilised and remaining values.

Suggested way is to display it in brackets beside the "Team velocity" label, like "Team velocity (100)".
item.summary: Show total sprint velocity

comments.comment: Now team velocity is displayed in sprint view

item.title: [STORM-109] Remaining Sprint velocity is not correctly updated when doing drag&drop
item.description: When moving stories between backlog and sprints, the utilised/remaining quantities are not incremented/decremented by the story's size but by some other value.
item.summary: Remaining Sprint velocity is not correctly updated when doing drag&drop

item.title: [STORM-108] Use standard BT colors in Release Planning
item.summary: Use standard BT colors in Release Planning

item.title: [STORM-107] Use standard BT colors in Sprint Planning
item.description: Use standard BT colors in Sprint Planning
item.summary: Use standard BT colors in Sprint Planning

item.title: [STORM-106] W is for Won't
item.description:
In the MoSCoW acronym, the W stands for "Won't", not "Would".

Change all references to "would" in code with "wont".
item.summary: W is for Won't

item.title: [STORM-105] Cannot edit size and/or value and/or MoSCoW status of red-box stories
item.description:
Stories that are in the redbox (null size) cannot have the value of size set in-place.

Moreover, the business value field is displayed in the column for size.
item.summary: Cannot edit size and/or value and/or MoSCoW status of red-box stories

comments.comment: Reopening because the issue is fixed for release planning but is still present in the sprint planning page.

item.title: [STORM-104] Use Story interface in Comparator classes
item.description: Use Story interface in Comparator classes
item.summary: Use Story interface in Comparator classes

item.title: [STORM-103] Improve "affordance" of draggability
item.description:
The uesr interface should make clearer when a story can or cannot be dragged, e.g. by changing the pointer to a hand when hovering over a draggable story.

See http://www.jnd.org/dn.mss/affordances_and.html for the meaning of "affordance".
item.summary: Improve "affordance" of draggability

item.title: [STORM-102] Editing of size and value is disabled after reordering
item.description: After backlog is reordered, in-place editing of size and value fields seems to be disabled. It stays disabled even if one orders by rank again.
item.summary: Editing of size and value is disabled after reordering

item.title: [STORM-100] New standard configuration for sprint 3
item.description:
Change the IntegrationTestData.xml file in our repository to have a new configuration for this sprint.
We need to have a new issue type for developer stories and some issues of this type.
item.summary: New standard configuration for sprint 3

comments.comment: We already have a Developer Story issue type.

item.title: [STORM-99] Order by in release backlog
item.description:
Add a button to sort the backlog stories in parent child view.
Component stories are sorted first, and developer stories later.
item.summary: Order by in release backlog

item.title: [STORM-98] Allow user to automatic rank the component stories
item.description:
Allow user to automatic rank the component stories in backlog.
The user must be choose the automatic rule to rank the stories in backlog between Priority or MoSCoW.
item.summary: Allow user to automatic rank the component stories

item.title: [STORM-97] Order backlog by specified field in flat view
item.description:
The user may specify an order field for the backlog.
The backlog must be ordered by: Rank, MoSCoW, Key, Title, Size, Value and Priority.

Pay attention to reuse code made in Release Planning.
item.summary: Order backlog by specified field in flat view

item.title: [STORM-96] Initial rank of the developer stories
item.description:
When we have a component stories without rank we must rank on first load of Sprint Planning page.
We would rank this following the order by priority.
item.summary: Initial rank of the developer stories

item.title: [STORM-95] Retrieve and show stories in flat view
item.description:
In the LHS of layout must be shawn all developer stories and also a component stories without children.

This is a cause of a question:
The rank field for developer stories use the same custom field of component stories?
In this case we have an override of rank assigned in Release Planning.
To solve this problem we need a different custom field to manage the developer stories rank.

Pay attention to reuse the code made for Release Planning.
item.summary: Retrieve and show stories in flat view

item.title: [STORM-94] Red box in Parent Child View
item.description:
Create a red box to contains the unplannable stories rendered with parent child view.

If the component story has a plannable and unplannable stories, the component story must be shown in red box and also in plannable box.
item.summary: Red box in Parent Child View

item.title: [STORM-93] Red box for unplannable developer stories (flat view)
item.description: Unplannable stories are all stories with null size value.
item.summary: Red box for unplannable developer stories (flat view)

item.title: [STORM-92] Component story must return a list of developer stories
item.description: Create an object structure (and related interface) to allow component story to return a list of developer stories.
item.summary: Component story must return a list of developer stories

comments.comment: Doesn't RankableIssue#getChidlren already implement this?

item.title: [STORM-91] Add parent child view to sprint planning backlog
item.description:
Allow user to change the view from flat to parent child (and vice versa).
All developer stories must be shown as child of component stories. See the ppt scratch for more details.
Child story must sorted by rank for flat and parent child view.
item.summary: Add parent child view to sprint planning backlog

item.title: [STORM-90] Allow changes to attributes for component stories allocated in backlog
item.description: Allow editing in place of value and moscow field.
item.summary: Allow changes to attributes for component stories allocated in backlog

item.title: [STORM-89] Hide / show link
item.description: Hide/Show link for developer stories in backlog of parent child view.
item.summary: Hide / show link

item.title: [STORM-88] Define the relationship between component and developer stories
item.description: Define an object structure to describe the relationship between component and developer stories.
item.summary: Define the relationship between component and developer stories

item.title: [STORM-87] Retrieve the sprints list for a release
item.description: Retrieve the sprints list for a release from a release.
item.summary: Retrieve the sprints list for a release

item.title: [STORM-86] Retrieve planned stories in sprint section
item.description: Retrieve planned stories in sprint section. The sprint value is stored in a custom field.
item.summary: Retrieve planned stories in sprint section

item.title: [STORM-85] Order by in sprint section
item.description: Add a button to choose the desired order by in sprint section. Refactor the action and comparator class already utilised.
item.summary: Order by in sprint section

item.title: [STORM-84] Compute used team velocity
item.description: Compute team velocity used up for each sprint.
item.summary: Compute used team velocity

comments.comment: How is computed 'Utilised' field in the sprint planning? Can we use the same logic contained in UsedAggregator closure?

item.title: [STORM-83] Editing in line on days field
item.description: Editing in place on days field for each sprint.
item.summary: Editing in line on days field

item.title: [STORM-82] Automatic rank inside sprint section
item.description: Automatic rank inside sprint section. Rank must start from 1 for each sprint.
item.summary: Automatic rank inside sprint section

item.title: [STORM-81] Vertical drag and drop of the developer stories in sprint section
item.description: Vertical drag and drop of the developer stories inside and between sprint causes a change of rank.
item.summary: Vertical drag and drop of the developer stories in sprint section

item.title: [STORM-80] Drag and drop between release and sprint boxes (flat view)
item.description:
Drag and drop between release and sprint boxes (flat view) through javascript and action class refactoring.

Keep the order of the selected boxes.
item.summary: Drag and drop between release and sprint boxes (flat view)

item.title: [STORM-79] Choose release for sprint planning
item.description: Modified the page where is possible to choose the project to planning its releases. Under each project insert a link for each release. When user clicks on release he will be redirected to the sprint planning page.
item.summary: Choose release for sprint planning

item.title: [STORM-78] Drag and drop from backlog to sprint in parent child view.
item.description:
Allow drag and drop from backlog to sprint in parent child view and not vice versa.
We have another story to do the drag and drop from sprint to backlog.
item.summary: Drag and drop from backlog to sprint in parent child view.

item.title: [STORM-77] Populate Sprint
item.description: Create an action and Insert a button to allow the automatic populate of selected sprint. The sprint is populated taking the developer and the component stories without child stories according to the order by rank,
item.summary: Populate Sprint

comments.comment:
In sprint planning screen the populate button is on top of screen.
What means this? Would populate button fill all sprints and not only selected sprint like in release planning?
Move it to each sprint and let it populate a single sprint, as it works for releases.

item.title: [STORM-76] Remove stories from parent child view
item.description:
Solution 1;
Remove the developer stories from sprint dragging it in any position of release section.
The story will be assigned to correct component story and ranked as last.

Solutiont 2:
Remove the developer stories from sprint dragging it in correct parent component story. The rank will be assigned according to the dropped position.
item.summary: Remove stories from parent child view

comments.comment:
This has to be implemented without drag&drop. Simply add a "move to backlog" (back arrow?) icon to stories in a sprint and be done with it.

This icon must be present also when the backlog is in flat mode.

To sum it up, when in parent-child mode, disable drag&drop from sprint to backlog.

item.title: [STORM-75] Highlight dependency violation
item.description:
Show a warning when somebody tries to plan a story in a way that violates a dependency.

E.g. story B depends on story A and story A is planned for release 2, pop up a warning message when somebody tries to allocate story B to release 1.

Do not prevent actually doing this operation, only give a warning.

Stories which violate dependency constraints must be highlighted somehow.

Automatic population of releases/sprints should take dependencies into account.
item.summary: Highlight dependency violation

item.title: [STORM-73] Multiple solution planning from CE stories
item.summary: Multiple solution planning from CE stories

item.title: [STORM-72] Multiple Component planning from Solution stories
item.summary: Multiple Component planning from Solution stories

item.title: [STORM-71] Overwriting rank on story in a release can move story to a different release
item.description:
When you overwrite the rank of a story that has been allocated to a release, if you input a rank that is one greater than the largest rank occupied by stories in the release, the story gets moved to the following release.

It must never be possibile to move stories between releases by changing the rank.

Also keep in mind that ranks must restart from 1 with every release, as described in STORM-53
item.summary: Overwriting rank on story in a release can move story to a different release

item.title: [STORM-70] MoSCoW order must be decreasing
item.description: When ranking or sorting stories by MoSCoW, stories must be sorted in decreasing priority order, that is Must, Should, Could, Would. Now they are ranked and sorted in the opposite direction.
item.summary: MoSCoW order must be decreasing

item.title: [STORM-69] Size and value are inverted
item.description:
The values that the planning plugin shows for "Size" and "Value" custom fields are swapped with respect to those shown in the issue detail page. If the issue detail page shows:

Business Value: X
Size: Y

then the planning tool will show size as Y and value as X.
item.summary: Size and value are inverted

item.title: [STORM-68] Colored bar display for residual velocity
item.description: Display total/remaining velocity for a release graphically, as a partially filled colored bar like it's don for sprints.
item.summary: Colored bar display for residual velocity

item.title: [STORM-67] Business Release Planning with Demand Stories
item.summary: Business Release Planning with Demand Stories

item.title: [STORM-66] Create Story Dependencies via the graphical planning interface
item.description:
As a team member or planner
I want to link stories
So that dependencies are clearly understood

Acceptance Criteria:
1) Can Stories be linked to show dependencies?
2) Can the link be made & shown visually on planning screens?
3) Can i filter to see only stories with dependencies?
4) Links are shown in a consistant way across different level?
5) Are the dependency types differenciated & shown (finish-start, finish-finish, start-start)
item.summary: Create Story Dependencies via the graphical planning interface

item.title: [STORM-65] Multi-Team Planning (on a single component)
item.summary: Multi-Team Planning (on a single component)

item.title: [STORM-64] MoSCoW Icons with M, S, C, W
item.description: Ask Jen for new icons and use them instead of the current ones.
item.summary: MoSCoW Icons with M, S, C, W

comments.comment: This is an integration issue. When the Agile Planning Plugin is deployed in STORM, it will use the icons defined for the custom priority values that are defined there and nothing needs to be done in the pkugin itself.

item.title: [STORM-63] Use standard BT colors
item.description: Use the standard BT color scheme for pages. The RGB values are indicated on Jen's slides.
item.summary: Use standard BT colors

item.title: [STORM-62] Disallow all changes to attributes for stories allocated to a sprint
item.description:
When a story is in a sprint box, do not allow changing value, size or moscow. Keep only the option of changing rank.

NB: The story should be moved back to the sprint backlog in order to be editied.
item.summary: Disallow all changes to attributes for stories allocated to a sprint

item.title: [STORM-61] Remove scrollbars from all boxes
item.description:
Remove all scrollbars of all boxes of releases and backlog.
The page maybe scroll only with page scrollbar.
The height of each box is the height of biggest box in the page.
item.summary: Remove scrollbars from all boxes

item.title: [STORM-60] Differenciate the 'look' of backlog stories from planned stories
item.summary: Differenciate the 'look' of backlog stories from planned stories

item.title: [STORM-59] Redesign of page layout
item.description:
Redesign the whole page layout to better match Jen's latest mockup. Basically we want the page to be divided into three, separate scroll-panes:

* One for the backlog (green box)
* One for the red box
* One for releases

Panes should be resizable using draggable dividers.

A non-scrolling header at the top must include all common operation buttons and links.

The relase pane might contain all releases and use a standard horizontal scrollbar to provide scrolling, no Javascript behavior needed to implement scrolling.
item.summary: Redesign of page layout

item.title: [STORM-58] Allow assigning Component Stories to a Sprint
item.description:
Stories candidate for assignment to a Sprint are:

- Developer stories
- Component stories that have no child Developer Stories
item.summary: Allow assigning Component Stories to a Sprint

item.title: [STORM-57] Multi-select of stories
item.description: Let the user select multiple stories at once for the purpose of dragging & dropping them as a unit.
item.summary: Multi-select of stories

item.title: [STORM-56] Search/filter of backlog
item.description: Let the user perform a search that would work in a similar way to JIRA's own "quick search" feature and use the results of the search to filter the backlog: i.e. show only those backlog issues that are also returned by the search.
item.summary: Search/filter of backlog

item.title: [STORM-55] Disallow all changes to attributes for stories allocated to a release or sprint
item.description: When a story is in a release box, do not allow changing value, size or moscow. Keep only the option of changing rank.
item.summary: Disallow all changes to attributes for stories allocated to a release or sprint

item.title: [STORM-54] Allow user to change release velocity
item.description:
Allow the user to change the velocity of a release from within the planning tool, without going through project administration.

The velocity cannot be set to a value lower than the sum of stories already planned for that release.
item.summary: Allow user to change release velocity

item.title: [STORM-53] Ranks must start at 1 for every release
item.description:
In the current version, stories are assigned ranks that start at 1 with the first release, and increment from there.

Ranks must actually restart at 1 within each release.
item.summary: Ranks must start at 1 for every release

comments.comment: Editing in place on rank field may be fixed in STORM-71

item.title: [STORM-52] Add re-rank button to release boxes
item.description:
User should be able to re-rank stories in a single release, just like it's done in the backlog

Provide a single 'Re-rank' button
-Priority (Business Value/Size)
-MoSCow

NB: Order By is separate to this story.
item.summary: Add re-rank button to release boxes

item.title: [STORM-51] Various errors in story details popup
item.description:
* Label for "Value" is "Value Key"
* Status is not shown
* Moscow field displays size actually
item.summary: Various errors in story details popup

item.title: [STORM-50] Order by MoSCoW does not work
item.description: When selecting "Order by MoSCoW" nothing happens. Stories stay ordered just like they were before clicking.
item.summary: Order by MoSCoW does not work

item.title: [STORM-49] Current sort column is not indicated
item.description:
As explained in the description for STORM-12:

"Also, the current sorting field and the fact that drag&drop is not possible should be made visible through the UI."

This is not currently implemented
item.summary: Current sort column is not indicated

comments.comment: Must be an improvement using an image to substitute the button, because the button is too large.

item.title: [STORM-48] When sorted by any other field but rank, stories can still be moved to the backlog
item.description:
In the description of STORM-12, it says:

"When stories are sorted by any field which is not rank, drag and drop should be disabled:

- from release to backlog
- within backlog

It should be allowed only from backlog to release. This is because it is not possible to determine the rank when dropping into the backlog if it is not ordered by rank. "

In the current version, this is implemented backwards, i.e. drag&drop is allowed from release to backlog and not from backlog to release. To summarize the correct behavior:

- LEFT TO RIGHT: OK
- RIGHT TO LEFT: NOT OK
item.summary: When sorted by any other field but rank, stories can still be moved to the backlog

comments.comment:
I'm not agree with this issue. Now it works following this rule: "I can drag story from any release/backlog ordered by any field to any release/backlog ordered by rank because these are the only ones that can assign a correct rank to the dragged story".

Is it necessary to able drag also to ordered releases?

No.

The behaviour you describe is the correct one, but at some point during my tests I thought it was not behaving correctly. It might just be that I was confused and made some mistake, so if you think it works OK, you can resolve this issue as "cannot reproduce".

item.title: [STORM-47] Backlog does not scroll
item.description: When the backlog is too long to fit in a browser page, no scrollbar appears and it is impossible to access issues which are below the fold.
item.summary: Backlog does not scroll

comments.comment: Now I have remove the scroll bar from backlog, can you comment and reopen this issue, or open a new issue to explain how backlog and release section must be scroll.

item.title: [STORM-46] Editing size inserts a line break
item.description:
When clicking on the size column to edit it, the value field is moved to the line below.

Maybe this is just because CSS display attribute of a <form> element has a value of "block" instead of "inline"?
item.summary: Editing size inserts a line break

item.title: [STORM-45] Drag and drop from release to backlog does not assign rank
item.description: When a story is dragged from a release and dropped in the backlog, it gets assigned a rank of 1 instead of the rank determined by the drop position.
item.summary: Drag and drop from release to backlog does not assign rank

item.title: [STORM-44] Layout flashes
item.description:
When displaying the page for the first time or refreshing it, elements are laid out using some CSS properties, then these properties change and the layout changes, which causes a "flash" in the UI.

The layout and the style of elements on the page should not change after the page is displayed.
item.summary: Layout flashes

comments.comment: I have an idea to solve this problem, but I prefer to move it to sprint 3 because this is a graphic improvement. What do you think about?
Even if it is a graphic improvement, the flash is quite annoying. If you think it can be fixed in less than 1 hour time, then please do it. If you think it will take more, then move it to sprint 3.

item.title: [STORM-43] Show only a limited number of stories in the backlog
item.description:
When there are more than a certain number of stories in the backlog (e.g. 50), display only the first 50, with a link "show more stories" at the bottom of the list.

When a user clicks the link, show 50 more stories without refreshing the whole page (AJAX?).

Repeat until all stories are visible.

The "50" above is just a typical value. The real value must be configurable.
item.summary: Show only a limited number of stories in the backlog

item.title: [STORM-42] Do not allow changing size of planned stories
item.description: When stories are planned for a release, do not allow changing the "size" field, otherwise you would have to update the remaining capacity and check that it does not go negative. Better make it read-only and not worry about those issues.
item.summary: Do not allow changing size of planned stories

item.title: [STORM-41] Drag and drop does not upgrade "fix for"
item.description: Drag story between releases and the backog and it appears correcly, but refresh the page and notice the story is still in the original release.
item.summary: Drag and drop does not upgrade "fix for"

item.title: [STORM-40] Drag&drop not working properly from backlog to release
item.description:
When doing a drag&drop from the backlog to a release, the "mouse up" event does not seem to be recognized, so the story box continues following the pointer even after the mouse button has been released. It takes an extra click to finish the drop action.

When this happens, Firebug reports the following error:

$("used" + parentOrigin) is null
[Break on this error] var currValue = Number($("used"+parentOrigin).innerHTML);
DraggableContainers.js (line 37)
item.summary: Drag&drop not working properly from backlog to release

item.title: [STORM-38] Moving story to a different release does not update remaining velocity of source release
item.description:
If I move a story from a release to the backlog, remaining velocity is correctly increased.

If I move a story from a release to another release, remaining velocity is not increased.

This was the case even before I changed the behaviour to show remaining velocity instead of used up velocity.
item.summary: Moving story to a different release does not update remaining velocity of source release

item.title: [STORM-37] Layout project structure following STORM conventions
item.description: As per Jobin's example, there should be an agile-planning-plugin directory containing Java code and templates, and an agile-planning-webapp directory containing web resources.
item.summary: Layout project structure following STORM conventions

comments.comment: We are waiting a feedback from Jobin, in the meanwhile I've a question for Ugo: do we want a tag directory or change our directories in trunk?
Go ahead with trunk, just raise a hand when you are about to do it so I can check in any penidng changes I might have.

item.title: [STORM-36] Truncate story descriptions after a given number of characters, on next word boundary.
item.summary: Truncate story descriptions after a given number of characters, on next word boundary.

item.title: [STORM-35] Releases must have an end date
item.description:
Releases must have an end date. This is needed by STORM-13 to determine future releases.

Either use the defult JIRA "Release date" field or a "start date" + "elapsed". In any case, talk to Jobin to agree on how we plan to store this information.

In the base data for tests (see STORM-26) include at least one release with a date in the past and at least three releases with dates in the future.
item.summary: Releases must have an end date

comments.comment: We are waiting a feedback about the release manager from Jobin

item.title: [STORM-34] Releases should scroll by 1, not by 2
item.description: When scrolling release boxes horizontally, scroll by one position, not two.
item.summary: Releases should scroll by 1, not by 2

item.title: [STORM-33] Release capacity is computed as capacity * length
item.description:
Don't know where this "length" field comes from, but it doesn't make sense to multiply "length" by capacity to obtain a "duration" value.

Only capacity (which should actually be called "velocity") is to be used for planning purposes.
item.summary: Release capacity is computed as capacity * length

item.title: [STORM-32] Empty release action
item.description: Provide a button or link to empty a release, that is move all the stories contained in it to the backlog.
item.summary: Empty release action

item.title: [STORM-31] Auto-populate must not update the browser URL
item.description:
After clicking the "Populate" button, the URL in the browser must remain the same as it was, so that hitting refresh on the browser shows a (possibly updated) view of the current planning, but does not resubmit another "populate" request.

This can be obtained using Ajax or sending browser redirect at the end of action processing.

As an inferior alternative, use a POST (form) command for submitting the "Populate" action, so trying to reload the page will have the browser request confirmation from the user. In this case, also provide a "refresh" button or link on the page itself.
item.summary: Auto-populate must not update the browser URL

comments.comment: Resolve this is with post of form and add a link to refresh the page.

item.title: [STORM-30] Upgrade POM to JIRA 3.13
item.summary: Upgrade POM to JIRA 3.13

item.title: [STORM-29] Show up to two releases side by side
item.description:
In the right hand side of the release planning page, show up to two releases side by side and not overlaid one on top of the other, as this makes it hard to move stories between releases by dragging and dropping.

Only if planning for more than two releases, use scrollbars or buttons to scroll horizontally only if there are three or more releases, always showing two at most.
item.summary: Show up to two releases side by side

item.title: [STORM-28] Remove dependency on visual part of ReleaseManager
item.description:
The Agile Planning Tool plugin must not contain the release data entry input form. The code should only be concerned with retrieving the attributes associated with each release (e.g. velocity) regardless of how it is input. The implementation for the storage of these attributes should be easily modifiable without modifying the client code.

Provide some version data in the initial configuration dump for testing.
item.summary: Remove dependency on visual part of ReleaseManager

item.title: [STORM-26] Provide base configuration for tests
item.description:
Provide a dump of the JIRA configuration that matches custom issue and field types specified in custom-ids.properties.

Store the configuration in a file that is read at startup by integration tests.
item.summary: Provide base configuration for tests

comments.comment:
Backup of configuration does not contain redefined priorities using the MoSCoW schema: default JIRA priorities must be substituted by the following four ones, in decreasing order of priority:

Must
Should
Could
Would
Icon URLs for MoSCoW priorities must also point to the correct icon.
Remember to substitute the would.gif resource location in atlassian-plugin.xml. Actually we haven't the correct image icon.

item.title: [STORM-25] Release planning
item.description: Parent story for all stories related to release planning.
item.summary: Release planning

item.title: [STORM-24] Story boxes must not show locked/unlocked icon
item.description: Boxes for stories must not display a padlock icon, as their plannable/unplannable status is already visually determined by their being in the green as opposed to the red box.
item.summary: Story boxes must not show locked/unlocked icon

item.title: [STORM-23] Layout of sprint planning page
item.description: Implement the layout of the sprint planning page according to Jen's mockup
item.summary: Layout of sprint planning page

item.title: [STORM-22] Layout of release planning page
item.description: Implement the layout of the release planning page following Jen's mockup
item.summary: Layout of release planning page

comments.comment: Release boxes must always appear to the right of the backlog, never below it.
Save horizontal space by not repeating the "Size" and "Value" labels. Put those labels in non-scrolling column headers.

See my comments. Basically we'd like to use less horizontal space in the backlog by removing or shrinking the "size" and "value" labels.

We would also like the story boxes in the right hand side (release boxes) to be much more similar to the left-hand-side ones (less tall and more wide). Basically shrink the backlog and widen the releases.

We must also ensure that the right hand side always stays to the right and is never pushed below the backlog.
See my screenshot with annotations

You ask to insert description on top of size and value.
Do you like something like this image?

Not much, the column headers should really be aligned with the columns themselves.

But I realize that it might be hard to implement, so even an approximate alignment would be OK.

In any case, the width of the columns must be made smaller, there is too much wasted space.

item.title: [STORM-21] Ensure browser compatibility
item.description: Ensure APT is at least compatible with Firefox 2 and 3, IE 6 (and 7 as a nice to have!).
item.summary: Ensure browser compatibility

comments.comment: Fixed the visualization issue on IE6 and IE7: now the Sprint View displays correctly all the related issues. Other compatibility issues on IE6+ will be addressed with new and distinct jira issues
Release and Sprint views are not displayed on IE6

item.title: [STORM-20] Change Sprint Velocity
item.description:
It must be possible to change the velocity for the current and future sprints.

If velocity is decreased for a sprint and the sum of story sizes for that sprint exceeds the new sprint velocity, display a warning.
item.summary: Change Sprint Velocity

item.title: [STORM-19] Show sprint status
item.description: On right hand side of sprint planning page, sprint status (completed, In-Progress, future) must be shown. Status is a visual hit set by the tool, based on the sprint dates.
item.summary: Show sprint status

comments.comment: Can you write more information about this issue?

item.title: [STORM-18] Show sprint backlog for planning
item.description:
When doing sprint planning, user must select a release, then left hand side of page must contain developer stories that are children of component stories planned for the selected release.

NB: The sprint backlog is the list of stories that have been dropped into a specific release. This backlog is then use for sprint planning and is hierarchical (i.e. contains Component stories & thier Developer stories, Developer stories are not mandatory)
item.summary: Show sprint backlog for planning

item.title: [STORM-17] Drag and Drop (between boxes)
item.description:
User must be able to drag and drop between boxes to assign stories to a release or to the backlog.

Check that we are not overflowing capacity before allowing a drop.
item.summary: Drag and Drop (between boxes)

item.title: [STORM-16] Red box
item.description:
Red box contains stories that cannot be planned. At release level it includes stories with no size.

Note: stories with size = 0 can be planned, therefore they are not in the red box. Story with size = null cannot be planned, so they are in the red box.

At sprint level it includes developer stories with no size and component stories with no children.
item.summary: Red box

item.title: [STORM-15] Sprint planning
item.description:
Everything that has been described for release planning must be done at the sprint planning level too, using:

* sprints instead of releases
* developer stories instead of component stories
*Component stories if they don't have children
item.summary: Sprint planning

comments.comment: Please see Jen's slide entilted: Proposed SPRINT page (Drag & Drop)

item.title: [STORM-14] Parent-child view
item.description: User must be able to switch backlog to parent-child view, where stories are grouped by parent story. When in parent-child view, reordering is not allowed.
item.summary: Parent-child view

comments.comment: Drag and drop is allowed?

Drag and drop from the backlog to a release is allowed.

Drag and drop from a release to the backlog is not allowed.

Reordering the backlog via drag and drop is not allowed.
Started developing the Java bits
Java bits implemented as methods getParentIssue() and getChildIssues() in RankableIssue class.

item.title: [STORM-13] Select releases
item.description: Select the set of releases to be shown in the planning board, by default the current release and the next one.
item.summary: Select releases

comments.comment: We need more information to identify the current release
Agreed, I will take care of this issue myself.

item.title: [STORM-12] Sort stories
item.description:
User can choose to sort stories by key, title, size, value, MoSCoW or rank, inside a single box (backlog or release).

When sorted by any field but rank, do not allow reordering by drag and drop.
item.summary: Sort stories

comments.comment:
When stories are sorted by any field which is not rank, drag and drop should be disabled:

- from release to backlog
- within backlog

It should be allowed only from backlog to release. This is because it is not possible to determine the rank when dropping into the backlog if it is not ordered by rank.

Also, the current sorting field and the fact that drag&drop is not possible should be made visible through the UI.

item.title: [STORM-11] Show story details
item.description: When hovering the pointer over a story, display a popup showing more story details.
item.summary: Show story details

comments.comment:
Display at least these values:

* Key (no need to put label in front of it, just make it stand out)
* Size
* Value
* MoSCoW
* Full summary
* Full description
* Status
* Due date
* Reporter
* Assignee

This is how Mingle does it. We do not have the same fields to display, but I've attached this to show and example of how BT expects the popup to look like.

In other words, put some style in it, not just a plain 2-column table.

item.title: [STORM-10] Allow changing size, value, MoSCoW
item.description: User must be able to change size, value and MoSCoW status on an issue directly in the planning board. In this case, rank is not recomputed.
item.summary: Allow changing size, value, MoSCoW

comments.comment: How we can edit the priority (MoSCoW)? In Jira the priority is a select box, but use a select box in planning board isn't a good idea. Can we use something like an inplace editor?How we can edit the priority (MoSCoW)? In Jira the priority is a select box, but use a select box in planning board isn't a good idea. Can we use something like an inplace editor?
I don't have any specific ideas in mind for this, so it's up to you to find something that is usable and possibly simple to implement.

item.title: [STORM-9] Display release info
item.description:
Beneath a release tab display:

* total velocity (capacity)
* remaining capacity
* due date
item.summary: Display release info

item.title: [STORM-8] Compute rank using MoSCoW
item.description:
Stories must be ranked according to their MoSCoW (Must, Should, Could, Would) status.

Stories with equal MoSCoW are ranked in order of decreasing business value.
item.summary: Compute rank using MoSCoW

comments.comment: Stories are ranked by MoSCoW using the OrderByMoscow class. We need to make this ordering available to the user with a link or button in the page.
This operation is needed only for the backlog

The link is added to the layout, but I'm not agree about the works that do the OrderByMoscow. Because its compare first the rank and after the priority. I don't understand because it need to compare the rank.

I am keeping this issue open because, following Davide's comment, I want to make sure that the requirement has been correctly interpreted. Expect a clarification from me shortly.

Moreover, there needs to be a link to rank by priority (size/value) also, which is the default.

This is how ranking is supposed to work:

Initially stories have no rank. When the page is first displayed, stories are ranked by value/size. This assigns a rank value to stories (1 to N).

New stories might be created at a later date, with a null rank. When redisplaying the plugin page, those stories need to be ranked as well. All the stories are therefore sorted in the following way:

- already ranked stories keep their original rank
- new stories with no rank are sorted by value/size *after* already ranked ones, so they take ranks N+1 to N+P, where P is the numer of new stories.

Now what the "Rank by MoSCoW" link must do is re-rank *all* stories according to their MoSCoW value. Basically all rank values must be nullified and rank computed again, even for older stories. We are sorting the stack of stories again from scratch.

This is also why we need a "Rank by priority" link. To re-rank all stories from scratch, but using value/size as sorting criterion, instead of MoSCoW status.

To put it another way:

- keep existing ranks when displaying the page, rank non-ranked stories after ranked ones
- remove existing ranks and re-rank everything when clicking on one of the "Rank by priority"/"Rank by MoSCoW" links.

item.title: [STORM-7] Compute rank using size and value
item.description:
Stories are ranked according to a "priority" value that is computed as value/size.

Stories with no value are ranked in increasing size order (smaller ones on top).

Stories with no size are in a separate section ("red box") and cannot be moved or ordered until estimated.
item.summary: Compute rank using size and value

comments.comment:
Acceptance test #1

Create a set of 12 stories with the following values for value and size fields:

10 0
1 0
10 1
1 1
10 10
1 10
0 1
0 10
0 0
null 0
0 null
null null

Verify that the the first 8 stories appear in the top "green" box, in the order shown here.

Verify that the last 4 stories appear in the bottom "red" box.

item.title: [STORM-6] Allow overwriting rank
item.description: User must be able to type in new rank value. All other stories shift accordingly.
item.summary: Allow overwriting rank

comments.comment: The user change the rank value using drag and drop or typing the new value in a textfield?
The user is already able to change rank by means of drag and drop, so this issue requires that the user be allowed to change rank by typing the new value in a text field.

item.title: [STORM-5] Unfreeze release
item.description: Make frozen release modifiable again
item.summary: Unfreeze release

comments.comment: Please can you give us more information when the release must be frozen again?
This is accomplished by the user by clicking a freeze/unfreeze button or link.

item.title: [STORM-4] Freeze release
item.description: When a release is frozen its contents cannot be changed until unfrozen
item.summary: Freeze release

comments.comment: Maybe a Workflow Validator that return an error when the user try to edit a frozen issue
How user decide if the release is frozen or unfrozen?

Freezing a release is accomplished by the user clicking on a specific button or link.

Once a release is frozen, issues cannot be moved in and out of it. Issues can still be modified by the usual means (which possibly also include changing the "fix for" field.

It's just that you cannot use drag and drop in the planning tool to move issues in a frozen release.
The button or link to freeze/unfreeze release must be implemented by BT developers team.
Davide, referring to your latest comment, why is it so? Why can't we just add one more link/button like we do for Populate and Order By?

We could add a button/link on our release planning, but it's not our responsibility to handle release informations and status, that's why we have an interface for releases with only read operations.
it's up to you (BT) to decide whether we have to save information or use information, let's us know about it so we can request a modification to the ReleaseFinder and Release interface.

I think we have an obvious, implicit requirement here to be able to set the "frozen" attribute of a release. If the current interface does not allow for setting that attribute, we need to require an interface change from Jobin, Vijay et. al.

Until we have it, we can simply assume we will have some "freeze()" and "unfreeze()" methods and use them. We can then implement our UI on top of them. Or we can wait until we have an OK on the proposed interface change.

But in any case actually adding a button to the UI and wiring it to the appropriate code is up to us. It makes no sense to ask them to do it.

Only in case such changes as requested cannot be provided by BT, we will resolve the story as WONTFIX. Resolving it as FIXED when the required function cannot be performed by the user is not appropriate.

item.title: [STORM-3] Drag and drop (in-box)
item.description: User must be able to drag and drop stories inside a single box to change their rank. This includes the backlog and the releases.
item.summary: Drag and drop (in-box)

item.title: [STORM-2] Fill backlog
item.description:
The backlog contains the set of Component Stories that:

* are outstanding
* are not assigned to a release

The system must fill the backlog with all such stories when the planning board is displayed.

Initial ordering is by priority. This assigns a rank that will persist and must not be recomputed when invoking the tool a second time.
item.summary: Fill backlog

item.title: [STORM-1] Auto-populate release
item.description: Interface should display a "Populate" button for a release. When clicked, issues are moved from the backlog to the release, according to their rank, until release capacity has been used up.
item.summary: Auto-populate release
